intro: Manglietia calophylla, commonly known as the Mexican white manglietia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers. The plant has a woody stem and broad, ovate leaves that are often glossy in appearance. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance, attracting various pollinators such as bees and moths.
